summary:
I am a software developer who has been working with Java and Java Enterprise Edition (J2EE/JEE) since 2000. Prior to this I worked with C++.

I have served as a lead developer and architect in the development of large complex enterprise systems in the areas of Internet Banking, Market and Credit Risk Management and Equity/Equity Derivative Trading for financial institutions.

A core theme underlying my projects has been the design and development of large, scalable, distributed, service oriented architectures involving multiple machines and software tiers, clustering, grid computing and near real-time user interfaces using leading edge technologies.

I have experience with all aspects of object-oriented software development from conducting analysis workshops with the end user to gather requirements, to formulating an overall system architecture, designing the domain model and the underlying database, to designing and developing the user interface and the underlying backend services and communications layer.

profile_positions.description:
Internet banking.

Development of internet applications in the area of Debit and Credit cards. These ‘omni-channel’ applications are designed to serve customer needs across channels and can be used directly by the customer via mijn.ing.nl or by ING staff to support customers in the branches, call centre or back-office.

Environment: service oriented architecture with a front-end implemented in Angular JS and Polymer, connecting to restful API’s built using Java, Spring, JAX-RS, JMS to integrate with backend services exposed using Kafka, Tibco BusinessWorks and a distributed caching layer implemented using Cassandra.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Solvency II: calculation kernel of a Solvency II Internal Model implementation.

Design and development of a scalable, high performance, grid computing platform to support the demanding needs of Monte Carlo simulation techniques applied within the firm’s Internal Model. I developed a real-time web front-end as well as the compute grid capable of running multiple scenarios in parallel using the JEE 6 technology stack. 

Environment: distributed architecture using a set of JBoss servers connected (via JMS) in a master and many workers topology. Using JEE 6 (JBoss EAP6.1): JPA2 (Hibernate), JMS (HornetQ), CDI (Weld), EJB 3.1, JSF 2.1 (Mojarra), PrimeFaces, PrimeFaces Extensions, OmniFaces, Atmosphere, JQuery running against Oracle 11g on a Red Hat Linux platform.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
TracING: TracING is the ING Group’s global Market Risk system used to fill management and regulatory (Basel II) reporting requirements. I worked on two major components of the system: EventRisk and TrISS.

EventRisk: is the stress testing component of the system. I led the development of this system, taking it from analysis through to design and delivery. I designed a real-time front-end using Swing and a backend using J2EE (EJB's) for persistence of domain objects. A distributed grid architecture was created to provide a scalable computational environment for the evaluation of stress scenarios using JavaSpaces and Jini.

Environment: distributed J2EE/Space based architecture, front end: Swing Applications delivered over Java WebStart (JNLP) running on Windows. Server side: Websphere (3.5-6.x), JavaSpaces, Jini, Oracle 9i, Solaris/Sun E20000.

TrISS: TrISS - TracING Input Support System  acted as a gateway to external systems that delivered Position information and market data from ING branches globally. It modeled core reference data such as Instruments, Books, Legal entities etc. and provided inputs both to EventRisk and the VaR component of TracING. I developed the reference data aspect of the system using JSF for the front end, Hibernate for OR mapping and the Spring framework for dependency injection.
 
Environment: 3-tier Spring/Hibernate architecture, front end: JSF, Windows. Server side: Hibernate, Spring, Websphere, Oracle 9i, Solaris/Sun E20000.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Credit Risk Toolkit: this intranet system, which provides global credit risk management and reporting functionality to the bank, was suffering from significant performance problems that were compounded by a recent migration from an HP-UX to a SunE10K/Solaris platform.

I conducted a bottom up review of the data architecture and worked on optimisation at each tier: hardware utilisation, tuning of the Solaris environment, optimisation of the physical database layout, configuration and tuning of Sybase 12, optimisation of the physical model and finally a review of the application architecture.

Environment: 3 tier architecture, front end: Internet Explorer/Netscape, ASP. Server side: IIS, Sybase 12, Solaris 7/Sun E10000
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Involved with the development of two Market Risk Systems:

ARMIS: ABN AMRO’s Risk Management Information System, was envisioned as the bank’s central risk management system serving global market risk management and regulatory reporting needs. My primary task was the development of the 'framework for distributed parallel computation’ -  a set of C++ libraries which allowed the construction of distributed risk model components and coordinated their execution over a grid of HP-UX machines. In production the framework coordinated 16 HP-UX servers.

Environment: distributed peer-peer architecture with PC-NT GUI front-ends, interacting with HP-UX servers managed with Infinity’s InfTalk for communications. Using C++, Sybase 11, Infinity, RogueWave, HP-UX.

Market Risk Toolkit: intranet system providing real-time distribution of risk metrics, position browsing, limits management as well as access to calculation services providrd by ARMIS.

Environment: distributed n-tier architecture with Java applets, interacting with multi-threaded servers providing calculation and data services using RMI or RMI/IIOP. Using Java 1.2 (JNI, RMI, Swing, JDBC); J2EE (EJB), Borland’s JBCL (Java Bean Component Library), dbSwing, DataExpress; C++, InfTalk; HP-UX; Solaris; Windows NT.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description: Served as the technical lead in projects in the capital markets domain. Involved in three separate Trading system projects for clients of Cambridge: BZW (Equity Derivatives Trading System), Mercury Asset Management (Order management using FIX) and Credit Suisse First Boston (Migration of a trading system to the Fidessa platform).
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Equity trading systems: METS (Morgan's Equity Trading System) and GTW (Global Trading Workstation).

Environment: Heterogeneous network of PC’s running OS/2, Sun workstations running SunOS or Solaris. Using TCP/IP and Sybase’s TDS through smart routers (Service Brokers). Using C++, and Sybase: Server-Library (Open Server), DB-Library, Replication Server and SQL Server. GUI: developed using PM on OS/2 and Galaxy on SunOS and Solaris.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Reflex: a publication monitoring system, helps monitor the time critical production lifecycle of newspapers and magazines. Reflex provides a real-time view of the publication as it is developed around the world (on platforms including QuarkXPress, EdPage, FPO and the Press2Go family), through a backbone of replicated databases. My primary task was to build the foundation of the system by implementing a distributed, object-oriented database using interconnected Sybase SQL Servers.

Environment: C++, Sybase, AIX.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description: Clear Utilities: GUI framework for Visual basic.
profile_positions.title: Consultant
